item.title: Women Scientists Are Tweeting "Sexy" Photos Of Themselves At Work To Shut Down Sexism
item.description:
Marine biologists, archeologists, and many others are posting images with the hashtag #DistractinglySexy in response to comments made by British scientist Tim Hunt earlier this week.

Not a great statement to make at a conference honoring women in science.

View Entire List ›

group.description: Marine biologists, archeologists, and many others are posting images with the hashtag #DistractinglySexy in response to comments made by British scientist Tim Hunt earlier this week.

content.description: Not a great statement to make at a conference honoring women in science.
BuzzFeed News has reached out to Vagenda magazine for comment on its original tweet.

item.title: A Teen Mom Turned Designer Makes Bikinis To Hide Pregnancy Scars
item.description:
A.Lekay wants every woman to feel confident at the beach.

Meet Altrichia Cook, a 28-year-old mom and swimsuit designer in Lakeland, Florida.

Her friends call her A.Lekay.

In 2013, A.Lekay was on the hunt for a well-made and fashionable high-waist bikini that would hide the scarring related to the birth of her now-9-year-old son.

facebook.com

She couldn't find a swimsuit with a waist high enough to cover the scars, so she worked with a tailor to create her own design.

After posting photos on social media in her new beachwear, her friends began asking where she had gotten it.

instagram.com

Frankie Benjamin Photography

View Entire List ›

group.description: A.Lekay wants every woman to feel confident at the beach.

content.description:
Her friends call her A.Lekay.

In 2013, A.Lekay was on the hunt for a well-made and fashionable high-waist bikini that would hide the scarring related to the birth of her now-9-year-old son.
After posting photos on social media in her new beachwear, her friends began asking where she had gotten it.
"The idea transformed into a business," Lekay tells BuzzFeed Life. "Allusions by A.Lekay came to me."
The suit is available via email.

The positive feedback she received after posting her custom-made swimsuit in 2013 taught her that other women shared similar feelings. 

"As I have grown, I get so many thank-you emails of women thanking me," the mom and entrepreneur tells us. "One instance, a customer told me that she hadn't worn a two-piece swimsuit in over 20 years."
For women who have any abdominal scarring, whether from pregnancy or surgery, Allusions by A.Lekay offers fashionable swimwear they can wear on their journey to rebuilding their body confidence.

item.title: 22 Reasons To Be Glad You Grew Up In Canada In The '90s
item.description:
*When a kid could be a kid*

You got to experience all the haphazard weirdness of 1990s YTV.

Like this robot ballerina. Why? Because why not?

youtube.com

And came home to PJ Phil and Snit every day after school, where you learned world-class sass from Snit.

youtube.com

You were let in on the secret of the majestic House Hippo.

Which you still look for in open bags of chips.

youtube.com

You, then, could enjoy a nice bowl of Trix while watching Inspector Gadget on Saturday mornings.

Canadian kids have been denied the Trix experience since 2005.

IMPORTANT UPDATE: Trix is apparently here, IN CANADA, for a limited time this spring.

Creative Commons / Via Flickr: jeepersmedia

View Entire List ›

group.description: *When a kid could be a kid*

content.description: Like this robot ballerina. Why? Because why not?
Which you still look for in open bags of chips.
Canadian kids have been denied the Trix experience since 2005. IMPORTANT UPDATE: Trix is apparently here, IN CANADA, for a limited time this spring.
Well, maybe you still leave it open. Just in case.
Which made you start all your own stories with "It happened to a friend of a friend of mine."
Was it a requisite that at least one member of a '90s boy band have long hair?
When you'd carefully put away a $2 bill in your piggy bank *knowing* that it'd be worth a fortune one day.
You may or may not have pretended it was a Growers cooler like mom was drinking. IMPORTANT UPDATE: These are coming back too!! See? No one can deny the power of the '90s.
Actually, it's probably a good thing these aren't around anymore.
Such swag.
Where do kids get fitness tips these days?
Because what child doesn't want to create grape friends just to send them through a maze of torture devices?
And crazy ball. And dodgeball. Kids these days have nothing.
What is this travesty?
God forbid your mom forgot to send the little envelope full of toonies and loonies for your order.
In double VHS, of course.
It also inspired you to try to start your own school paper...which, of course, was full of stick men and the fascinating exploits of all your friends during recess.

And settle instead for wearing board shorts to school.

Also, Ryan Gosling...obviously.
Take THAT, 2015.

item.title: A Tattoo Artist Found The Most Genius Way To Cover Up A Rubbish Pokémon Tattoo
item.description:
Tattoo correction at its best.

A guy went to his local tattoo shop to get a regrettable Pokémon tattoo fixed and the results are better than any fully thought-out tattoo ever could have been.

Lindsay Barker / imgur.com

The cover up was created by Northampton, Massachusetts-based tattoo artist Lindsay Baker.

instagram.com

"It was his first tattoo and apparently the girl who did it had been drinking," Baker told BuzzFeed. "He's had it for almost four years".

Lindsay Barker / imgur.com

"I have tattooed this particular client a few times and he showed me the tattoo. I got excited and suggested we tattoo Pikachu drawing himself and my client told me he had the same idea."

Lindsay Barker / imgur.com

View Entire List ›

item.title: A Same-Sex Couple Had An Amazing Response To Parenting Advice From A Bunch Of Anti-Gay Strangers
item.description:
The Chiongs are ready to answer your hateful comments.

Olivia and Irene Chiong live in Singapore with their daughter, Zoe.

olivia.thechiongs.com

Olivia runs the blog The Chiongs to document not only what it's like raising a baby in a same-sex couple, but what it's like to do so in one of the most expensive cities on earth: Singapore.

olivia.thechiongs.com

This week, Olivia noticed a spike in her blog's traffic. When she investigated the source, she noticed her blog had been shared on the Facebook page “We are against Pinkdot Singapore” (WAAPD).

The group describes itself as "a public policy group" that "stands against the normalization of homosexuality within Singaporean society."

Facebook: 542917079078427

View Entire List ›

group.description: The Chiongs are ready to answer your hateful comments.

content.description: The group describes itself as "a public policy group" that "stands against the normalization of homosexuality within Singaporean society."
"As for the books that we buy for Zoey, she happens to have a library of over 500 books. We believe in diversity and so expose her to many different kinds of books and toys."
"Dear Bjorn Liu, yes, we are married. In fact we had a pretty awesome wedding in San Francisco about 6 months ago. Here’s a photo of our fabulous wedding entourage :)."

"I am happy to let you know that Zoey is a well-adjusted and well-liked child in her school. In fact, her teachers often comment that she is a delightful child whom everyone likes. She has no psychological/emotional problems to speak of and the only problem she has is she is quite messy when she eats and gets food everywhere."
"Perhaps you can try changing your last name to Vernon Straight and let us know if that works? If it does, we can consider to change our last names to Lesbian."

item.title: This Video Hilariously Compares Catcalling To Cheeseburgers
item.description:
Would you throw a cheeseburger at your mother?

Thanks to comedian and parody master Tess Paras, you may never look at cheeseburgers the same way again.

Tess Paras / Via youtube.com

In her newest video, Tess explores what catcalling would look like if catcalls were cheeseburgers.

Tess Paras / Via youtube.com

We see Tess going through her normal day, walking past men who hand her unsolicited cheeseburgers.

Tess Paras / Via youtube.com

Tess told BuzzFeed that the video is meant to "challenge the notion that catcalls are compliments that all women should enjoy."

Tess Paras / Via youtube.com

View Entire List ›

group.description: Would you throw a cheeseburger at your mother?

item.title: Canada Is Finally Getting Rid Of The "Tampon Tax"
item.description:
It’s about bloody time.

Rejoice, menstruating Canadians! The federal government will no longer charge GST on tampons as of July 1.

CBS / Via giphy.com

And not just tampons — the change applies to pads and menstrual cups, too.

Sanitary belts are also included, in case anyone still uses those.

HelloFlo / Via youtu.be

The change comes after a campaign from Canadian Menstruators, including a petition and cheeky video.

Canadian Menstruators / Via youtube.com

Their Change.org petition calling for an end to GST on menstrual products gained more than 74,000 signatures. As it pointed out, that little percentage on top of your purchase doesn't feel so little to everyone:

A small tax on tampons/pads/panty liners/menstrual cups adds up when combined with the systemic challenges many women, trans people, genderqueer people, and other menstruators face in terms of their income, housing, and economic stability.

View Entire List ›

content.description: Sanitary belts are also included, in case anyone still uses those.

Their Change.org petition calling for an end to GST on menstrual products gained more than 74,000 signatures. As it pointed out, that little percentage on top of your purchase doesn't feel so little to everyone:
A small tax on tampons/pads/panty liners/menstrual cups adds up when combined with the systemic challenges many women, trans people, genderqueer people, and other menstruators face in terms of their income, housing, and economic stability.
The petition also noted that wedding cakes and cocktail cherries have been tax-free this whole time.

item.title: 15 Reasons Why "The Mindy Project" Is Actually So Canadian
item.description:

Something unthinkable recently happened. FOX decided to cancel "The Mindy Project" and fans were not pleased.

"HOW DARE YOU!" – an angry mob

But don't worry because it's been picked up by a Canadian broadcaster!

The show will be returning to its prime-time schedule on City in Canada, despite being dropped by Fox in the United States. Hallelujah!

Fox / Via rose-petals-of-temptation.tumblr.com

Mindy understands what it's like to go a full 24 hours without Tim Hortons.

Fox / Via hellomewhatsup.tumblr.com

*polite mic drop*

item.title: This Hospital Threw A Giant Slumber Party For Its Young Patients
item.description:
Rock A Bye Baby in B Minor

MUHC

Little patients like Jouri Abdulmaola had to be packed up and moved to the new hospital.

Owen Egan / MUHC

Recently, ambulances lined up to move the patients. It was a long process, and tough on the children, many of whom are suffering from serious illnesses.

Owen Egan / MUHC

View Entire List ›

group.description: Rock A Bye Baby in B Minor

content.description: "It's a serious disease but he's a little cutie patootie," Kim Fraser, the hospital's vice president of marketing and communications, told BuzzFeed Canada.
"We thought, why not have them come to the children and play the world's biggest lullaby to help get kids asleep, because it's always weird when you are in a new building," Fraser said.

item.title: A Sneaky Cop Pretended To Be A Panhandler In Order To Bust Drivers On Their Phones
item.description:
Buddy, can you spare $167 for a traffic ticket?

Many drivers thought Cpl. Mark Taylor of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) was a panhandler when he stood at a busy intersection with this sign. But a closer reading reveals what he was really up to...

RCMP

Taylor would walk past cars at the intersection, peering in to see if the drivers had their seatbelts on, and to see if they were using their cell phone while driving, which is illegal.

RCMP

That made it easy for Taylor to radio to his colleagues around the corner in order to tell them which cars to stop, and for what infraction. Molendyk said 11 tickets were issued in an hour.

Is that a good tally?

"Put it this way, it was high enough that [the officers are] saying we'll be doing it again," Molendyk said.

RCMP

View Entire List ›

group.description: Buddy, can you spare $167 for a traffic ticket?

content.description:
That made it easy for Taylor to radio to his colleagues around the corner in order to tell them which cars to stop, and for what infraction. Molendyk said 11 tickets were issued in an hour. 

Is that a good tally?

"Put it this way, it was high enough that [the officers are] saying we'll be doing it again," Molendyk said.
"City police forces have been riding on buses so they can see down [at people using their phones]," he said. They've also pretended to be construction workers.

item.title: NHL Star P.K. Subban Joined A Street Hockey Game, Got Stopped By An 8 Year-Old
item.description:
“This says everything about what kind of a guy P.K. is.”

Usa Today Sports / USA Today Sports

Subban, wearing sandals, scored on Jack with a couple of one-timers.

youtube.com

View Entire List ›

group.description: "This says everything about what kind of a guy P.K. is."

content.description: Aaron Fraser lives on the street, which is located in lower Westmount. His son Jack, 8, plays centre for the Novice Westmount Wings. Jack put on the pads to get in net against Subban. "I am a goalie so he keeps trying to get me to let him play net, but he is a natural goal scorer so I am reluctant," Fraser said. Let's see how Jack did against one of the NHL's best.
Yes Jack!

"He was blown away but was trying to act cool and wanted to stop all of P.K.'s shots," said Fraser. "You could see him get discouraged when the first two went in but then he made a few saves and you could see his confidence swell."

"This says everything about what kind of a guy P.K. is," Fraser said. "P.K. is not only the most talented defenseman in hockey, he also does it with a smile on his face. The kids can sense it and they eat it up!"

item.title: What Happens When People Try Going A Week Without Looking In A Mirror
item.description:
“This has been the most body-positive week I’ve ever had.”

Mirrors are everywhere. They're there when you wake up, go to work, and go to the bathroom. What if you went a full week without looking at one? We got five participants to do exactly that, and they came out with a new outlook on body image.

youtube.com

BuzzFeed

Nearly everyone mentioned how much they do look at themselves in their mirror daily, as it was an essential part of looking and feeling good to them.

They were about to go from all to nothing real quick.

View Entire List ›

group.description: "This has been the most body-positive week I've ever had."

item.title: Piper And Alex Are Totally Back On In The New Season Of "Orange Is The New Black"
item.description:
“This is the sexiest season by far.”

Netflix has dropped another teaser for Season 3 of Orange Is the New Black, featuring interviews with stars Taylor Schilling and Laura Prepon and new cast member Ruby Rose.

youtube.com

As we learned in the season trailer, Alex Vause (Laura Prepon) has landed back in Litchfield.

Netflix

"In Season 3, Alex has to deal with the consequences of violating your parole," Prepon says. "You definitely do see more of Alex's vulnerable side. But Alex is, like, a total badass. That's the cool thing about her."

And it looks like Piper (Taylor Schilling) and Alex are going to ~rekindle~ things – presumably until Alex finds out Piper dobbed her in to the parole officer.

Netflix

View Entire List ›

group.description: "This is the sexiest season by far."

content.description: "In Season 3, Alex has to deal with the consequences of violating your parole," Prepon says. "You definitely do see more of Alex's vulnerable side. But Alex is, like, a total badass. That's the cool thing about her."

"As Piper's growing and Alex is growing, their dynamic is turned on its head a little," said Schilling. "Piper's in a stronger place than we've ever seen her before."

Prepon agreed, saying, "The interesting thing about the relationship is that the dynamic constantly changes between the two of them."
